alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Somerset and southwestern Worcester Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 748 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deal Island, or 10 miles southwest of Princess Anne, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Westover and Marion Station around 810 PM EDT. Pocomoke City and West Pocomoke around 830 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Oriole, Cokesbury, Fairmount, Upper Hill, Rehobeth, Kingston, Dames Quarter, Shelltown, Manokin and Upper Fairmount. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.
